poem:
Title: "In the Wake of Weeping"

Roads to rest, mired in maliciousness,
In Kerman's sorrow-filled square, a clandestine cataclysm.
Fetal in the newspaper's cold womb, an unruly unrest
Raises its unseen, scarlet shadow over serenity.
Oh, Suleimani, in your martyr's mirth, do you too mourn?
In the tired tongues of the fallen, what laments unfurl?
A gossamer grief floats, spreading under the indifferent sun,
Devoted, indelible as the dawn's sepulchral light.
